newsitem.title: GERMANY: Buba's Kuehbacher wants early decision on EMU members.
newsitem.headline: Buba's Kuehbacher wants early decision on EMU members.

text.p: German Bundesbank council member Klaus-Dieter Kuehbacher said on Monday he wanted the decision on who would participate in European monetary union to be brought forward.
Kuehbacher, speaking on German television, said that the decision on whether Germany could take part or not should be made after Germany's key May budget appraisal at the latest.
Referring to the deficit-to-gross domestic product ratio criterion, he added: "We should certainly not admonish those nations who are approaching the three percent (deficit-to-GDP) level".

There has been much speculation that Germany will not meet the three percent deficit-to-GDP threshold by the end of this year. EU head of states are due to decide on monetary uniion membership early next year on the basis of 1997 data.
Bonn has said it is targeting a deficit at 2.9 percent of GDP this year.
